Ta-Urt

What Egyptian goddess with the forequarters of a lion, the hindquarters of a hippopotamus, and the head of a crocodile devoured the unjust?
Am-mit

What most terrifying Hindu goddess, the wife of Shiva, is often identified with Durga and depicted as black, naked, old, hideous, and sometimes with eight arms?
Kali

(1768--93) What French political assassin assassinated revolutionary leader Jean Paul Marat in his bath in 1793 and was found guilty of treason and guillotined four days later?
Charlotte Corday

What form of hemoglobin is measured to determine one's blood sugar levels?
glycated hemoglobin (hemoglobin A1c)

What name for a small territorial and administrative district forming the most local level of government in the Philippines comes from the Tagalog for ``neighbourhood''?
barangay

What knee-length trousers are cut with full legs to resemble a skirt?
culottes

What sixteenth- or seventeenth-century cannon had a relatively long barrel for its bore, typically about ten to thirteen feet long?
culverin

What is the Latin term for ``with a grain of salt''?
cum grano salis

What does ``cum laude'' mean?
with praise

What historic port city and capital of Sucre state in Venezuela is located on the Manzanares River and said to be the oldest European settlement in South America?
Cumaná

What historic pass through the Appalachian Mountains runs from southwestern Virginia to southeastern Kentucky?
Cumberland Gap

What county in northwestern England with its county town in Carlisle was an ancient British kingdom and formed as a county in 1974, largely from the former counties of Westmorland and Cumberland?
Cumbria

What liquid hydrocarbon made catalytically from benzene, chiefly as an intermediate in phenol synthesis, has the chemical formula C6H5CH(CH3)2?
cumene/isopropyl benzene

What word of Urdu-Persian origin refers to a sash worn around the waist, especially as part of a man's evening clothes?
cummerbund

What cloud forms a towering mass with a flat base at fairly low altitude and often a flat top, as in thunderstorms?
cumulonimbus

What cloud forms rounded masses heaped on each other above a flat base at fairly low altitude?
cumulus

(1787--1865) What Canadian-born British shipowner founded the steamship company that still bears his name with the aid of a contract to carry the mail between Britain and Canada? The first such voyage for the company was made in 1840.
Sir Samuel Cunard

What rare c-word refers to the action or an instance of delaying?
cunctation

What is something wedge-shaped called?
cuneate

What English chieftain and powerful ruler made the town of Camulodunum (Colchester) his capital and established a mint?
Cymbeline

In what shallow, porous container can gold or silver be refined or assayed by melting with a blast of hot air, which oxidizes lead or other base metals?
cupel

What is the Greek equivalent of Cupid?
Eros

What complex ion, Cu(NH3)4 (2+), formed in solution when ammonia is added to copper salts, is deep blue as a solution and used to dissolve cellulose?
cuprammonium

What is the chief town of Curaçao?
Willemstad

What was the largest island in the Netherlands Antilles?
Curaçao

What name is given to a tropical Asian plant of a genus that includes turmeric, zedoary, and other species that yield spices, dyes, and medicinal products?
curcuma

What name is given to a parish priest in a French-speaking country or region?
curé

What surgical instrument is used to remove material by a scraping action, especially from the uterus?
curette

What is the name of the papal court at the Vatican by which the Roman Catholic Church is governed and which comprises various Congregations, Tribunals, and other commissions and departments?
Curia

What southern Brazilian city is the capital of Paraná?
Curitiba

Family Compositae, what edible Mediterranean plant's bitter leaves may be blanched and used in salads?
endive

What were the first names of Currier and Ives?
Nathaniel, James

With what adjective is something described if it has a curved beak?
curvirostral

Complete the proverb: ``Curiosity killed the [---].''
cat

Who was the eldest son of Ham?
Cush

What metabolic disorder caused by overproduction of corticosteroid hormones by the adrenal cortex often involves obesity and high blood pressure?
Cushing's syndrome

What group of Afro-Asiatic languages is found mainly in Ethiopia and Somalia and includes Somali and Oromo?
Cushitic

Where was Custer's Last Stand?
Little Bighorn

When is St. Cuthbert's feast day?
20 March

What waxy, water-repellent substance occurring in the cuticle of plants consists of highly polymerized esters of fatty acids?
cutin

What long, slender marine fish with sharp teeth and a dorsal fin running the length of the back is named after a weapon it resembles?
cutlassfish

What was the only survivor of the British tea clippers, launched in 1869 and now preserved as a museum ship at Greenwich, London?
Cutty Sark

What straight-sided, optically clear container is used for holding liquid samples in a spectrophotometer or another instrument?
cuvette

(1769--1832) What French naturalist founded palaeontology?
Georges Cuvier

Contradictory to its name, what volatile and strongly acidic liquid is actually colourless and has the chemical formula HOCN?
cyanic acid

What vitamin found in foods of animal origin such as liver, fish, and eggs, a deficiency of which can cause pernicious anemia, is also called ``vitamin B12''?
cyanocobalamin

What colourless, flammable, poisonous gas has the chemical formula C2N2?
cyanogen

What name is given to a bluish discoloration of the skin resulting from poor circulation or inadequate oxygenation of the blood?
cyanosis

What characteristic inflorescence of the spurges, resembling a single flower, consists of a cup-shaped involucre of fused bracts enclosing several greatly reduced male flowers and a single female flower?
cyathium

What mother goddess was worshiped especially in Phrygia and later in Greece (where she was associated with Demeter), Rome, and the Roman provinces, with her consort Attis?
Cybele

What large group of islands in the southern Aegean Sea were regarded in antiquity as circling around the sacred island of Delos?
Cyclades

What does ``CRC'' abbreviate in computing?
cyclic redundancy check

What phylum established for a minute marine invertebrate (Symbion pandora) discovered in the 1990s attached to the mouthparts of lobsters is related to the phyla Bryozoa and Entoprocta?
Cycliophora

What curve (resembling a series of arches) is traced by a point on a circle being rolled along a straight line?
cycloid

What colourless toxic liquid derived from the distillation of coal tar is insoluble in water, soluble in alcohol, and used in the manufacture of insecticides and resins?
cyclopentadiene

Cyclops Polyphemus

swan

Cygnus

What is a cornice moulding with an S-shaped cross-section called?
cyma

cyme

What is the Welsh term for the Welsh language?
Cymraeg/Cymric

What is the Welsh name for Wales?
Cymru

cypsela

Savinien Cyrano de Bergerac

What hereditary disorder affecting the exocrine glands causes the production of abnormally thick mucus, leading to the blockage of the pancreatic ducts, intestines, and bronchi and often resulting in respiratory infection?
cystic fibrosis

What name is given to a larval tapeworm at a stage in which the scolex is inverted in a sac, typically found encysted in the muscle tissue of the host?

What name is given to the inflammation of the urinary bladder?

What name is given to any of a group of polycyclic compounds produced by fungi that are used experimentally in research for their property of interfering with cell processes?
cytochalasin

What term is given to any of a number of substances, such as interferon, interleukin, and growth factors, which are secreted by certain cells of the immune system and have an effect on other cells?
cytokine

What kind of herpes virus usually produces very mild symptoms in an infected person but may cause severe neurological damage in people with weakened immune systems and in the newborn?
cytomegalovirus

D layer

Dante Gabriel Rossetti

Richard D'Oyly Carte

sfumato

What law states that the pressure exerted by a mixture of gases in a fixed volume is equal to the sum of the pressures that would be exerted by each gas alone in the same volume?
Dalton's law

What is the velocity addition formula of relativity?
$$ v_{AC} = \frac{v_{AB} + v_{BC}}{1 + (v_{AB}v_{BC})/c^2} $$

How do you measure rapidity?
measure the hyperbolic angle that differentiates two frames of reference in relative motion

What are the first five perfect numbers?
6, 28, 496, 8128, 33550336

This French mathematician, who was educated at École Normale Supérieure, constructed the cannonball problem, proved that $2^{127} - 1$ was prime by hand, studied in great depth the Fibonacci sequence, and wrote Théorie des nombres. Name this inventor of the Tower of Hanoi puzzle.
Édouard Lucas

davit

What does ``DDOS'' stand for?

What does ``BIOS'' stand for?

What does ``DDT'' abbreviate?

What is the chemical formula of DDT?

(1931--2015) What American college basketball coach coached the University of North Carolina from 1961 until 1997, establishing a career record of 879 wins and 254 losses and also coached the 1976 American Olympic team to a gold medal?
Dean Smith

What psychoanalytic term refers to an innate desire for self-annihilation, thought to manifest in the psyche's conservative and regressive tendency to reduce tension?

What noun refers to the tolling of a bell to mark someone's passing?

What is the lowest point in the US?

What is the interruption or destruction of the inward connections of nerve cells called, performed primarily in animal experiments to demonstrate the spontaneity of locomotor movement?

What d-word refers to the mouth of a river or valley?
debouchure

What is debridement?
the removal of damaged tissue or foreign objects from a wound

What unit used to express electric dipole moments of molecules is equivalent to $3.336 \times 10^{-30}$ coulomb metres?
debye

(1884--1966) What Dutch-born American chemical physicist (Nobel Prize for Chemistry, 1936) is best known for establishing the existence of permanent electric dipole moments in many molecules, demonstrating the use of these to determine molecular size and shape, and modifying Einstein's theory of specific heats as applied to solids?
Peter Debye

What Greek-derived term refers to the Ten Commandments?
Decalogue

What work by Boccaccio, written between 1348 and 1358, contains a hundred tales supposedly told in ten days by a party of ten young people who had fled from the Black Death in Florence and was influential on later writers such as Chaucer and Shakespeare?
Decameron

What colourless liquid hydrocarbon of the alkane series is present in petroleum products such as kerosene?
decane

What verb refers to the gradual pouring of wine from one container into another to not disturb the sediment?
decant

What order of crustaceans includes shrimps, crabs, and lobsters?
Decapoda

What events comprise the decathlon?
100-metre dash, long jump, shot put, high jump, 400-metre dash, 110-metre hurdles, discus, pole vault, javelin, 1,500-metre run

What triangular plateau in southern India is bounded by the Malabar Coast in the west, the Coromandel Coast in the east, and the Vindhya mountains in the north?
Deccan

What group led an unsuccessful revolt against Tsar Nicholas I in 1825?
Decembrists

What thick layer of modified mucous membrane lines the uterus during pregnancy and is shed with the afterbirth?
decidua

What name is given to the problem of finding a way to decide whether a formula or class of formulas is true or provable within a given system of axioms?
decision problem

What is the German for ``decision problem''?
Entscheidungsproblem

What Roman emperor (249--51) was the first Roman emperor to promote systematic persecution of the Christians?
Decius

What papermaking machine device is used to limit the size of the sheet and consists of a continuous belt on either side of the wire?
deckle

What type of long-term memory involves conscious recollection of particular facts and events?
declarative memory

What name is given to the bridge player whose bid establishes the suit of the contract and who must therefore play both their own hand and the exposed hand of the dummy?
declarer

What axis of an equatorially mounted telescope is orthogonal to the polar axis?
declination axis

What is a declivity?
downward slope

What liquor results from concentrating the essence of a substance by heating or boiling, especially a medicinal preparation made from a plant?
decoction

What condition, suffered particularly by divers (who often call it ``the bends'') and called ``caisson disease,'' results when sudden decompression causes nitrogen bubbles to form in the body's tissues and can cause pain in the muscles and joints, cramps, numbness, nausea, and paralysis?
decompression sickness

What stage of English Gothic church architecture typical of the fourteenth century (between Early English and Perpendicular) included increasing use of decoration and geometric, curvilinear, and reticulated tracery?
Decorated

What does it mean to decorticate something?
remove the bark, rind, or husk from it

What is the art or craft of decorating objects with paper cut-outs?
decoupage

What Latin noun refers to a collection of decisions and judgments in canon law?
Decretum

What posture is adopted by someone lying down?
decubitus

What is the technical term for ``bedsore''?
decubitus ulcer

What adjective describes a plant lying along the ground or a surface, with the extremity curving upward?
decumbent

If things are decussating, what are they doing?
crossing to form an X

What name is given to the open gallery for spectators at the service side of a tennis court?
dedans

What is the radial distance from the pitch circle of a cogwheel or worm wheel to the bottom of the tooth space or groove?
dedendum

What is laisser-aller?
carelessness, slovenliness

Define ``intransigent.''
unwilling or refusing to change one's views or to agree about something

What ancient Greek school of philosophy was founded in Athens by Zeno of Citium?
Stoicism

What village in southeastern Jamaica founded in 1494 by the Spanish was the centre of shipping and commerce in the seventeenth century?
Port Royal

Define ``salutary.''
(especially concerning something unwelcome or unpleasant) producing good effects; beneficial

What type of ancient Greek pottery vessel used to pour small quantities of liquids such as oil has a flat shape and a spout at one or both ends that could also be used as a handle?
askos

What Columbia University mathematician gave a lower bound for the class number of an imaginary quadratic field assuming the existence of an elliptic curve whose $L$-function had a zero of order at least three at $s = 1/2$ that Gross and Zagier later discovered?
Dorian Goldfeld

This mathematician found a counterexample to Euler's sum of powers conjecture for fourth powers, proved that an elliptic curve over the rational numbers is supersingular at infinitely many primes, discovered an elliptic curve with lower bound rank 28 and another with exact rank 20, and extended Schoof's algorithm. Who is this chess master, chess composer, and musical genius who was advised by Benedict Gross and Barry Mazur and made a tenured professor at Harvard at 26?
Noam Elkies

Define ``concomitant'' as an adjective.
naturally accompanying or associated

Define ``concomitant'' as a noun.
phenomenon that naturally accompanies or follows something

What northeast Scottish river rises in the Grampian Mountains and flows east past Balmoral Castle to the North Sea at Aberdeen?
Dee

What name is given to a body of people, typically influential members of government agencies or the military, believed to be involved in the secret manipulation or control of government policy and derived from a Turkish term?
deep state (derin devlet)

What brand of diethyltoluamide, a colourless oily liquid with a mild odour, is used as an insect repellent?
Deet

What does it mean to defalcate?
embezzle

What is the action or process of rendering something null and void in law?
defeasance

What title conferred on Henry VIII by Pope Leo X in 1521 was recognized by Parliament as an official title of the English monarch in 1544 and has been borne by all subsequent sovereigns?
Fidei Defensor

What does ``Fidei Defensor'' mean?
Defender of the Faith

What is the abatement of a fever as indicated by a decrease in bodily temperature called?
defervescence

What is the protection of a position, vehicle, or troops against enemy observation or gunfire called?
defilade

What name is given to combustion propagating through a gas or across the surface of an explosive at subsonic speeds, driven by heat transfer?
deflagration

What chemical, used in warfare, removes the leaves from trees and plants?
defoliant

What is the derivative of the Riemann zeta function at $0$?
$$ -\frac{1}{2}\pi\log 2 $$

What is $\zeta(2)$?
\begin{align*}\frac{\pi^2}{6}\end{align*}

What is $\zeta(4)$?
\begin{align*}\frac{\pi^4}{90}\end{align*}

What is $\zeta(6)$?
\begin{align*}\frac{\pi^6}{945}\end{align*}

What is $\zeta(12)$?
\begin{align*}\frac{691\pi^{12}}{638512875}\end{align*}

By what name is $\zeta(3)$ known?
Apéry's constant

What is pointing the foot to an open position with an arched instep slightly off the floor called in ballet?
dégagé

(1834--1917) What French impressionist painter and sculptor is known for his paintings of ballet dancers, such as Dancer lacing her shoe?
Edgar Degas

What verb is used to say ``remove unwanted magnetism from to correct colour disturbance''?
degauss

What is the technical term for swallowing?
deglutition

What rat-like rodent with a long silky coat (family Octodontidae) is found in southern South America?
degu

What does it mean to degust?
taste carefully, to appreciate it fully

What is the technical term for a pod or seed vessel to gape or burst open?
dehisce

What naturally occurring weak androgenic steroid hormone produced by the adrenal glands with the chemical formula C19H28O2 prevents ageing, improves sexual function, enhances athletic performance, and can treat osteoporosis?
DHEA (dehydroepiandrosterone)

What enzyme catalyzes the removal of hydrogen atoms from a particular molecule, particularly in the electron transport chain reactions of cell respiration in conjunction with the coenzymes NAD and FAD?
dehydrogenase

What does ``Dei gratia'' mean?
by the grace of God

What wife of Hercules was tricked into smearing poison on a garment that caused his death?
Deianira

What outer, smaller, football-shaped Martian satellite was discovered in 1877?
Deimos

It was prophesied that this tragic heroine's beauty would bring banishment and death to heroes. King Conchobar of Ulster wanted to marry her, but she fell in love with Naoise, son of Usnach, who with his brothers carried her off to Scotland. They were lured back by Conchobar and treacherously slain, and she took her own life. Who is this figure of Irish myth?
Deirdre

(1798--1863) What chief painter of the French romantic school is known for his use of vivid colour, free drawing, and sometimes violent subject matter?
Eugène Delacroix

(1885--1941) What French painter painted some of the first purely abstract pictures and was one of the founding members of Orphism, together with his wife, Sonia?
Robert Delaunay

What is the process of reducing the level of one's debt by rapidly selling one's assets?
deleverage

What home of painters Pieter de Hooch and Jan Vermeer is also noted for its pottery?
Delft

Who made Delhi the capital of the Mughal empire in 1638?
Shah Jahan

This alliance of ancient Greek city-states, dominated by Athens, joined in 478--447 BC against the Persians. It was disbanded on the defeat of Athens in the Peloponnesian War (404 BC) but again united under Athens's leadership against Spartan aggression in 377--38 BC. Identify this league that is also called the Athenian empire.
Delian League

What woman betrayed Samson to the Philistines (Judges 16) by revealing to them that the secret of his strength lay in his long hair?
Delilah

What psychotic condition is typical of withdrawal in chronic alcoholics, involving tremors, hallucinations, anxiety, and disorientation?
delirium tremens

What literary noun of Germanic origin refers to a small valley, usually among trees?
dell

(c. 1374--1438) What Italian sculptor is noted for the biblical reliefs on the portal of San Petronio in Bologna (1425--35)?
Jacopo della Quercia

(1400--82) What Italian sculptor and ceramicist is best known for his relief panels in Florence Cathedral and his colour-glazed terra cotta figures?
Luca della Robbia

What 290 km-long peninsular region in the eastern United States includes Delaware, the eastern shore of Maryland, and a small strip of Virginia, separating Chesapeake Bay from the Atlantic Ocean?
Delmarva

What name refers to a small steak cut from the front section of the short loin of beef?
Delmonico steak (club steak)

(b. 1925) What French socialist politician, president of the European Commission (1985--94), pressed for a closer European Union and oversaw the introduction of a single market within the European Community, which came into effect on 1 January 1993?
Jacques Delors

What small Greek island in the Aegean Sea, regarded as the centre of the Cyclades, was considered sacred to Apollo in classical times and, according to legend, was the birthplace of Apollo and Artemis?
Delos

What most significant religious sanctuary of the ancient Greek world, situated on the lower southern slopes of Mount Parnassus above the Gulf of Corinth, was dedicated to Apollo, was thought of as the navel of the earth, and housed the Pythia?
Delphi

What small constellation (the Dolphin) is just north of the celestial equator near Cygnus?
Delphinus

What name is given to a triangular arrangement of electrical three-phase windings in series, each of the three wires of the circuit being connected to a junction of two windings?
delta connection

What name is given to the brain's electrical activity at a frequency of around 1--8 Hz, typical of sleep?
delta rhythm

What is a postcard collector called?
deltiologist

What partially refined light brown cane sugar originally came from Guyana?
demerara

What adjective is used to describe fish living close to the floor of the sea or lake?
demersal

What goddess of cereal grains was the daughter of Cronus and Rhea, the mother of Persephone, and associated with Cybele?
Demeter

In whose honour were the Eleusinian mysteries held?
Demeter

What class of women in nineteenth-century France were considered to be of doubtful morality and social standing?
demimonde

Who was Democritus's teacher?
Leucippus

What form of mange is caused by follicle mites and tends to affect the head and foreparts?
demodectic mange

(384--322 BC) What Athenian orator and statesman is known for his political speeches on the need to resist the aggressive tendencies of Philip II of Macedon (the Philippics)?
Demosthenes

What is a substance that relieves irritation of the mucous membranes in the mouth by forming a protective film called?
demulcent

What is a charge payable to the owner of a chartered ship in respect of failure to load or discharge the ship within the time agreed called?
demurrage

What paper size is now standardized at 564 by 444 mm?
demy

What is the basic monetary unit of North Macedonia?
denar

What ancient Roman silver coin was originally worth ten asses?
denarius

What verb refers to the destruction of the characteristic properties of a biological macromolecule by heat, acidity, or other effects that disrupt its molecular conformation?
denature

What name is given to a synthetic polymer with a structure of repeatedly branching chains, typically forming spherical macromolecules?
dendrimer

What is the science or technique of dating events, environmental change, and archaeological artifacts by using the characteristic patterns of annual growth rings in timber and tree trunks?
dendrochronology

What is the brightest star in the constellation Cygnus, a yellow supergiant?
Deneb

What is the second brightest star in the constellation Leo?
Denebola

(b. 1943) What French actress is noted for Repulsion (1965), Belle de jour (1967), and Indochine (1992)?
Catherine Deneuve

(1904--97) What Chinese communist statesman, vice premier (1973--76, 1977--80), and vice chairman of the Central Committee of the Chinese Communist Party (1977--80) was discredited during the Cultural Revolution but reinstated in 1977 and became the leader of China?
Deng Xiaoping

(d. c. 250, feast day: 9 October) What Italian-born French bishop and patron saint of France was one of a group of seven missionaries sent from Rome to convert Gaul (according to tradition), became bishop of Paris, and was martyred in the reign of the emperor Valerian?
St. Denis

(1713--84) What French philosopher, writer, and critic was a leading figure of the Enlightenment in France and a principal editor of the Encyclopédie (1751--76), having written Le rêve de d'Alembert (1782) and Le neveu de Rameau (1805)?
Denis Diderot

What extinct species of human of robust build was distributed from Siberia to Southeast Asia in the Upper Paleolithic?
Denisovan

(1900--79) What Hungarian-born British electrical engineer conceived the idea of holography and won the Nobel Prize for Physics (1971)?
Gábor Dénes (Dennis Gabor)

What is the chief city of Bali?
Denpasar

What does ``Deo gratias'' mean?
thanks be to God

What does ``Deo volente'' mean?
God willing

What sugar has the chemical formula C5H10O4?
deoxyribose

What are convenience stores called in Quebec?
dépanneurs

What is the innate corruption of human nature due to original sin called?
depravity

What adjective, coming from the Latin for ``about the thing,'' means ``relating to the properties of things mentioned in an assertion or expression, rather than to the assertion or expression itself''?
de re

What bicycle mechanism moves the chain out and up, allowing it to shift to different cogs?
derailleur

(1880--1954) What French painter and exponent of Fauvism designed theatre sets and costumes, notably for the Ballets Russes?
André Derain

What order of insects comprises the earwigs?
Dermaptera

What name is given to the lateral wall of each somite in a vertebrate embryo, giving rise to the connective tissue of the skin?
dermatome

What name is given to the inflammation of the skin and underlying muscle tissue, involving degeneration of collagen, discoloration, and swelling, typically occurring as an autoimmune condition or associated with internal cancer?
dermatomyositis

What family of small beetles includes many kinds that are destructive (especially as larvae) to hides, skin, fur, wool, and other animal substances?
Dermestidae

What small order of mammals comprises the flying lemurs or colugos?
Dermoptera

What motorized bicycle is used to set the pace in racing events such as a keirin?
derny

What kind of crane named after the surname of a London hangman has a movable pivoted arm for moving or lifting heavy weights, especially on a ship?
derrick

(1930--2004) What Algerian-born French philosopher and literary critic was a leading figure in the theories of deconstructionism and postmodernism?
Jacques Derrida

What does DES abbreviate in biochemistry?
diethylstilbestrol

What does DES abbreviate in computing?
data encryption standard

What literary verb that means ``talk tediously or at length'' can also be a noun referring to an independent treble melody usually sung or played above a basic melody?
descant

In what year was René Descartes born?
1596

In what year did René Descartes die?
1650

Around what piece of metal is a rope passed to slow descent during rappelling?
descendeur

Define ``descry.''
catch sight of

What name was proposed in the 1840s by Mormon settlers for Utah?
Deseret

(1891--1944) What German field marshal known as the Desert Fox captured Tobruk in 1942 as commander of the Afrika Korps but was defeated by Montgomery at El Alamein later that year, committing suicide after being implicated in the officers' conspiracy against Hitler?
Erwin Rommel

What name is given to a hygroscopic substance that is used as a drying agent?
desiccant

(c. 1469--1536) What Dutch humanist and scholar was the foremost Renaissance scholar of northern Europe and paved the way for the Reformation with his satires on the Catholic Church?
Desiderius Erasmus

What potato variety that was originally bred in the Netherlands has red skin with yellow waxy flesh?
Desiree

The presence of what single-celled freshwater alga that appears to be composed of two rigid cells with a shared nucleus is usually an indicator of unpolluted water?
desmid

(b. 1928) What British zoologist and writer wrote The naked ape (1967) and Animal-watching (1990) after studying animal behaviour and the implications for the human condition?
John Desmond Morris

By what structure are two adjacent cells attached, formed from protein plaques in the cell membranes linked by filaments?
desmosome

What river in western Russia and Ukraine rises east of Smolensk and flows for 885 km to enter the Dnieper River near Kyiv?
Desna River

What French-derived word refers to a ruler or other person who holds absolute power, typically one who exercises it cruelly or oppressively?
despot

What does ``desquamate'' mean?
come off in scales or flakes

What name was given to a medieval knight's warhorse?
destrier

What kind of matrix consists of ``blocks,'' where each block has a particular eigenvalue on its diagonal and ones on its superdiagonal?
Jordan (normal form)

What is the approximate angle between the hydrogen atoms in water?
104.5 degrees

Approximately how far is the centre of hydrogen to oxygen in water?
0.957 angstroms

What name is given to the evolutionary reversion to a primitive linear body plan in gastropod mollusks?
detorsion

From the Latin for ``wear away,'' what rare noun refers to wearing something away by friction?
detrition

What smooth muscle component of the urinary bladder facilitates contraction of the bladder wall during micturition?
detrusor

What son of Prometheus survived a flood sent by Zeus to punish human wickedness with his wife Pyrrha, who was then instructed to throw stones over his shoulders to repopulate the world?
Deucalion

What Greek-derived Latin phrase refers to an unexpected power or event saving a seemingly hopeless situation, especially as a contrived plot device in a play or novel?
deus ex machina

What is the person second in importance to the protagonist in a drama called?
deuteragonist

What is colour-blindness resulting from insensitivity to green light, causing confusion of greens, reds, and yellows?
deuteranopia

What name is given to the supposed later author of Isaiah 40--55?
Deutero-Isaiah

What monetary unit of Germany was equal to one-hundredth of a mark?
pfennig

What name was given to a member of a class of divine beings in the Vedic period? They are benevolent in Indian religions and evil in Zoroastrianism.
deva

In what ballet movement is one leg is raised to the knee of the supporting leg, then unfolded and kept in a fully extended position?
développé

What supreme goddess of Hinduism is often identified with Parvati and Shakti?
Devi

What rocky island off the coast of French Guiana was used from 1852 to 1953 as a penal settlement, especially for political prisoners?
Devil's Island

What rock column 264 m high in northeastern Wyoming is a national monument on the Belle Fourche River?
Devil's Tower

What is the county town of Devon?
Exeter

What velvet fabric has a pattern formed by burning the pile away with acid?
devoré

What does DEW abbreviate?
distant early warning

What name is given to a central finance department, chief administrative office, or regional governing body in Islamic societies?
diwan

What double-walled flask of metal or silvered glass with a vacuum between the walls is used to hold liquids at well below ambient temperature?
dewar

(1837--1917) What American naval officer was appointed commodore of the navy in 1896 and heralded as the hero of the battle of Manila Bay in 1898 during the Spanish-American War?
George Dewey

What is the Welsh name for St. David?
Dewi

What name is given to the fold of loose skin hanging from the neck or throat of an animal, especially that present in many cattle?
dewlap

What drug (C22H29FO5) that is a more potent synthetic analog of cortisol is used chiefly as an anti-inflammatory agent?
dexamethasone

What adjective denotes something of or on the right side or right hand?
dextral

What adjective denotes something of or on the left side or left hand?
sinistral

What carbohydrate gum is formed by the fermentation of sugars, consisting of polymers of glucose?
dextran

What soluble gummy substance obtained by hydrolysis of starch is used as a thickening agent and in adhesives and dietary supplements?
dextrin

What oil town in eastern Saudi Arabia was an Allied forces port and military base during the Persian Gulf War?
Dhahran

What fertile province in southern Oman was the site of a rebellion in the 60s and 70s?
Dhofar

What word from the Greek for ``made of general ingredients'' refers to a solution or remedy for all difficulties or diseases?
diacatholicon

What name is given to a celebration held on 5 November?
bonfire night

What constant, commonly denoted alpha, is approximately $1/137$ and quantifies the strength of the electromagnetic interaction between elementary charged particles?
fine structure constant

What German biologist, chemist, and physician is responsible for the principle of conservation of energy?
Julius von Mayer

What were enzymes initially called?
ferments

How many amino acids are there?
twenty

What functional group contains a carbon-nitrogen double bond and is sometimes called a Schiff base?
imine

What adjective refers to stamens united by their filaments to form two groups?
diadelphous

What is a diadem?
jewelled crown or headband

What mark is placed over a vowel to indicate that it is sounded in a separate syllable, like in naïve?
dieresis

What is the fifth and last stage of the prophase of meiosis, following diplotene, when the separation of homologous chromosomes is complete and crossing over has occurred?
diakinesis

What Marxist theory postulates that political and historical events result from the conflict of social forces and are interpretable as a series of contradictions and their solutions?
dialectical materialism

What volcanic crater overlooks Honolulu port?
Diamond Head

On what island is Honolulu?
Oahu

What state is known as ``the Diamond State''?
Delaware

What early Italian goddess was associated with hunting, virginity, and the moon?

What genus of plants includes the pinks and carnations?
